history.content: Hi there! I'm one of the course staff for Data 8 so maybe I can help. We do recommend that Data 8 won't be completely worth your time if you have done more advanced coursework than just CS 61A, however, our focus isn't completely on the computer science side of things, but rather statistical analysis of data and using programming to help you develop insights about data and trends. If this sounds like something you'd be interested in, you can definitely take the class, though you might find the assignments themselves on the easy side for at least the first few weeks. If you have no experience with statistics at all (personally I think CS 70 counts for this though) then you might find it worth your while.

children.subject:
If you're interested in the subject, you can try auditing the first few lectures and lab sections to see how redundant the class is for you. I'm taking CS 61A this fall and I'm interested in the Data 8 class as well, so I'm seeing if I can do something similar.

Then again, I'm just a freshman so my advice may not be the most helpful out there...

Thanks! On the data science website it says that CS 194-15 is an upper-div alternative to C8. On Calcentral it says that CS 194 is offered this semester, so I was wondering if that is the class that you'd recommend taking?

history.content: Hi guys, I just found out about the Data Science courses and I am very interested, but I'm an incoming junior this fall. I'm declared Cog Sci and still hoping to declare CS, but might have to minor in it because my GPA is a bit too low. I've taken the 61 series, CS 70, and Math 54. I'm hoping to take some courses in the Data Science curriculum, but I read that CS/INFO/STATS C8 may not be worth the time since I've taken most of the lower-div reqs for the CS major already :/ I'd still really love to take the class and get an intro to data science though! I was just wondering if it's not advised for me to do so?
history.subject: Taking CS C8 as an incoming junior?
